name: remoteview
description: Fly a browser remotely from your browser? Yes.

scripts.tsc-server: tsc --types node --target ES2020 --checkJs --allowJs --outFile typetests/server.js --module System server.js decs.d.ts
scripts.tsc-inject: tsc --target ES2020 --checkJs --allowJs --outFile typetests/inject.js --module System zombie-lord/injections/**/*.js decs.d.ts
scripts.tsc-public: tsc --target ES2020 --checkJs --allowJs --outFile typetests/inject.js --module System public/*.js decs.d.ts
scripts.check: rm -f public/*bundle*.js && ( npm run lint || : ) && npm run tsc-check
scripts.build: npx webpack server.js && nexe -t linux-x64 -o BrowserGap.nix -i BrowserGap.js -r "./zombie-lord/injections/**/*" -r "./plugins/**/*.js" -r "./public/**/*" && nexe -t windows -o BrowserGap.exe -i BrowserGap.js -r "./zombie-lord/injections/**/*" -r "./plugins/**/*.js" -r "./public/**/*" && nexe -t macos-x64 -o BrowserGap.macos -i BrowserGap.js -r "./zombie-lord/injections/**/*" -r "./plugins/**/*.js" -r "./public/**/*" && nexe -t windows-x32 -o BrowserGap.win32.exe -i BrowserGap.js -r "./zombie-lord/injections/**/*" -r "./plugins/**/*.js" -r "./public/**/*" && nexe -t linux-x32 -o BrowserGap.nix32 -i BrowserGap.js -r "./zombie-lord/injections/**/*" -r "./plugins/**/*.js" -r "./public/**/*"
scripts.pack: upx BrowserGap.exe && upx BrowserGap.nix && upx BrowserGap.macos && upx BrowserGap.win32.exe && upx BrowserGap.nix32

author: @dosy
